marklogic.body:
LFTR is Liquid Fluoride Thorium Reactors
CCGT is Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (eta: I think natural gas should be reserved for direct use in Heating and for cooking, which would mean that useful reserves would last for an extremely long time, and avoid losses converting it to electricity then back into Heat, and losses from transmission, etc)
LENR(?) is Low Energy Nuclear Reaction
LENR seems to be confirmed by NASA http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=mxeKeuh_2Bw and appears to be different to 'Cold Fusion' which may be, in some circumstances, the same thing, in others, 'Cold Fusion' might be a scam (it may Depend what particular 'Cold Fusion' is being talked about, as important information is so far lacking).
